biography.value:
“A massive, mechanical scorpion rears its stinger, the tail's segments sloshing with colorful alchemical solutions inside them. Puffs of noxious gas discharge from nozzles poking through the gaps in its armor.”

Constructing and maintaining a clockwork scorpion requires mastery of both engineering and alchemy. Because of this, they are usually built with the cooperative work of multiple artisans. Being the sole creator of a clockwork scorpion is considered a mark of prestige.

Valued Guardians.

Nobles that enjoy supporting scientific pursuits might commission a master crafter that they're sponsoring to create a clockwork scorpion for them. This allows the noble to show off their protégé's skills while improving their home's protection.

languages.custom: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

description.value: The clockwork scorpion makes one Sting attack and two Claw attacks.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 ([[/damage 1d12 + 4 type=bludgeoning]]) damage, and the target is &Reference[condition=grappled] (escape DC 16). The clockwork scorpion has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+8]]{+8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 ([[/damage 1d10 + 4 type=piercing]]) damage plus 22 ([[/damage 4d10 type=poison]]) damage. The scorpion then chooses one of the following alchemical solutions, and the target must make a [[/save ability=constitution dc=16]] saving throw. The effect is determined by the chosen solution.

On a failed save, the target sees enemies everywhere for 1 minute. On its turn, the target uses its action to make a melee attack against the nearest creature that is not the clockwork scorpion, moving up to its speed toward the creature, if necessary. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target succeeds on the initial save, it is &Reference[condition=charmed] until the end of its next turn.

On a failed save, the target falls &Reference[condition=unconscious] for 1 minute. This effect ends for the target if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to wake it. On a successful save, the target is &Reference[condition=incapacitated] until the end of its next turn.

On a failed save, the target is &Reference[condition=poisoned] for 1 minute. While &Reference[condition=poisoned] in this way, the target is unable to speak or cast spells that require verbal components. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target succeeds on the initial save, it is &Reference[condition=poisoned] in this way until the end of its next turn.

The clockwork scorpion spews acid in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=16]] saving throw, taking 42 ([[/damage 12d6 type=acid]]) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The clockwork scorpion doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.
The clockwork scorpion is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.
The clockwork scorpion has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

When the clockwork scorpion takes damage, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 5 ([[/damage 1d10 type=poison]]) damage. If the damage it took was fire, the gas ignites and deals an extra 5 ([[/damage 1d10 type=fire]]) damage.
